casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee v. Enrique Marquez SANCHEZ, Defendant-Appellant. No. 07-50505

Conference Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. Aug. 20, 2008. Joseph H. Gay, Jr., Assistant U.S. Attorney, U.S. Attorney’s Office, Western District of Texas, San Antonio, TX, for Plaintiff-Appellee. Alvaro Martinez, Law Offices of Alvaro Martinez Jr., Midland, TX, for Defendants Appellant.

Before GARZA, CLEMENT, and SOUTHWICK, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM: *

The attorney appointed to represent Enrique Marquez Sanchez has moved for leave to withdraw and has filed a brief in accordance with Anders v. California, 886 U.S. 738, 87 S.Ct. 1396, 18 L.Ed.2d 493 (1967). Sanchez has not filed a response. Our independent review of the record and counsel’s brief discloses no nonfrivolous issue for appeal. Accordingly, counsel’s motion for leave to withdraw is GRANTED, counsel is excused from further responsibilities herein, and the APPEAL IS DISMISSED. See 5th Cm. R. 42.2.

Pursuant to 5th Cir. R. 47.5, the court has determined that this opinion should not be published and is not precedent except under the limited circumstances set forth in 5th Cir. R. 47.5.4.
